results.title: The Changing wheat belt
results.brief_description: Shows the life of the wheat farmers of the West during the 1960’s and the changes their life and work are undergoing. Farms are larger but need fewer men. The drift is to the city where new industries develop, but wheat still dominates western life.

results.title: The Changing Middle East
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation and Sam Bryan
results.brief_description: Discusses the history of the Middle East. Contrasts old ways with the new in agriculture, industry etc. in emphasizing the changing image of this part of the world.

results.title: The Changing hills
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Dennis Hill Productions and John Martin-Jones
results.brief_description: Tells of the way in which the Snowy Mountains Hydro-electric Scheme has altered the area and its way of life. Traces the development of the scheme, outlining the vast scientific and engineering resources and processes bringing the project to fruition. Shows how the project has brought new leisure and pleasure to Australia and Australians.

results.title: The Changing forest
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, J.V. Durden and Maurice Constant
results.brief_description: A brief essay on the ecology of a forest area of the type found along the southern fringes of the Laurentian Shield. We see the forest as an integrated community of living things, both plant and animal, balanced by conflict as well as by harmony, and learn why the maple tree is best able to survive the struggle for supremacy in the Laurentian forest area. Awards: New York; Rome

results.title: The Changing forest
results.creator_credit: Pilot Films, National Benzole, John Taylor and Patrick Carey
results.brief_description: This film is about the work the Forestry Commission is doing by way of land conservation and re-afforestation over their two-and-a-half million acres in Britain. Their interest in preservation of wild life and use of land for recreation is also outlined. Shots of Scotland and the Lake District at various seasons of the year are included.

results.title: The Changing earth
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Bert Haanstra
results.brief_description: Shows how the structure of the earth has been continuously changing from the start of geological time. The action of natural forces, heat, wind, rain and ice cause rocks to crumble, forming silt which is carried down into the ocean to form layers of sediment on the sea bed. Pressure of further layers deposited above, produces the rocks in which oil is slowly formed from the remains of the marine life. Animated diagrams show how the oil under pressure tends to migrate through the rocks, until it either finds its way through to the surface or is trapped in one of the formations for which oil-seekers look.

results.title: The Changing cotton land: USA - the southeast
results.creator_credit: United World Films, Louis De Rochemont and Bill Colleran
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
In this section of southeast America, cotton and tobacco have depleted the soil over a long period of time and the damage done is now being slowly repaired. new crops and new industries are being introduced. The film shows something of the work of the county agent at Laurel, Mississippi, who visits every farm and aids the farmer in improving the crops and livestock. Students at the State Agricultural College experiment with seeds, soil analysis, etc. Crops include pecan trees, tung trees, legume crops, sweet potatoes etc. A program of conservation of the forests is in operation, and the saw mills turn out wood fibre for composition board. Textile factories from the north provide additional employment.

results.title: The Changeover
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Eileen Molony
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Discovery and Experience”.
As there is growing emphasis in education on what a child does rather than what the teacher says, a gradual change in teaching methods and class management has taken place. Discusses new concepts in teaching, teacher training, classroom organisation and the attitude of the teacher to the children. Suitable for teacher training.

results.title: The Changeling
results.creator_credit: Joel B Michaels, Garth Drabinsky and Peter Medak
results.brief_description: A grieving composer, George C Scott, moves to Seattle after the tragic death of his wife and daughter in a car accident. He discovers the house he has moved into harbours a secret and is inhabited by the spirit of a child who lived there 70 years ago. He is determined to find the explanation behind the terrifying paranormal activities. Based on a true story this film also stars Trish Van Devere, John Colicos and Jean Marsh
